security_audit.summary: This is a prompt-based documentation skill with no executable code. It provides workflow guidance and a review checklist. The skill makes no file system calls, network requests, or code execution. The mentioned linting/testing commands are advisory examples for the AI assistant to consider, not automated executions.

content.user_title: Review code like a senior engineer
content.value_statement: Code reviews are essential for software quality but can be inconsistent without a systematic approach. This skill provides a structured workflow and comprehensive checklist covering quality, security, performance, and maintainability to ensure thorough, consistent reviews.
actual_capabilities: Provides structured code review workflow following senior engineer practices
Uses comprehensive checklist covering quality, security, performance, and maintainability
Suggests running project-specific linting and testing commands
Guides documentation of constructive feedback with rationale
Includes security review checklist items like input validation and secrets detection
limitations: Does not execute code or run tests automatically
Does not integrate with CI/CD systems or version control
Does not store review history or track metrics
Does not access external security vulnerability databases

use_cases.title: PR code review
use_cases.description: Review pull requests systematically before merging to ensure code quality and catch issues early.

use_cases.title: Security-focused review
use_cases.description: Identify security vulnerabilities using dedicated security checklist including input validation and auth checks.

use_cases.title: Team review standardization
use_cases.description: Establish consistent review standards across the team using the comprehensive checklist framework.

prompt_templates.title: Quick PR review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this pull request using the review-code skill. Check for code quality, security issues, and test coverage.

prompt_templates.title: Security audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code focusing on security. Check for input validation, authentication, authorization, and hardcoded secrets.

prompt_templates.title: Performance review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code for performance issues. Look for N+1 queries, inefficient algorithms, and missing caching opportunities.

prompt_templates.title: Comprehensive review
prompt_templates.scenario: Full code review with all checks
prompt_templates.prompt: Do a complete code review using the full review-code checklist. Cover quality, security, performance, maintainability, and architecture.

output_examples.input: Review this pull request that adds user authentication
output: Quality: Good naming, clear functions, but some duplication in validation logic
Security: Missing input validation on registration endpoint, hardcoded API key found (line 42)
Performance: Database queries look optimized, consider adding caching for user sessions
Maintainability: Well documented, consider extracting validation to shared module
Testing: Good test coverage for auth flow, add edge case tests for invalid inputs

best_practices: Use the full checklist for comprehensive reviews to avoid missing critical areas
Run linting and testing tools mentioned in the checklist before finalizing review
Provide constructive feedback with clear rationale and suggested alternatives
anti_patterns: Skipping security checks to save time on seemingly simple changes
Focusing only on style while missing functional or security issues
Not verifying that fixes are properly implemented in follow-up reviews

faq.question: What tools does this skill integrate with?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-based skill. It provides guidance for using project-specific tools like ESLint, pytest, and npm audit.

faq.question: What programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: Language-agnostic. The workflow applies to any programming language. Specific tool examples are provided for common languages.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code?
faq.answer: No. This skill provides review guidance only. It does not execute any code or make changes to your codebase.

faq.question: Is my code data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill runs entirely in your AI assistant context. No code is sent to external services or stored anywhere.

faq.question: Why are my reviews inconsistent?
faq.answer: Without a systematic approach, reviewers may miss areas or apply different standards. This skill provides a consistent checklist.

faq.question: How is this different from automated linting?
faq.answer: Automated tools catch syntax and style issues. This skill catches design, architecture, security, and logic issues that require human judgment.
